intro: Miliusa wayanadica, commonly known as the Wayanad miliusa, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white fruits that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in evergreen forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
